title.narrative: CHILD-SENSITIVE POLICIES/PLANS/ACCOUNTABILITY

description.narrative: By 2019, domestic actors have enhanced capacity for development of child-sensitive policies and plans, as well as the consideration of social accountability in public processes., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and vulnerable people have access to sustainable social protection programmes and are benefitting from increasedbudget allocations in the social sectors.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2019, domestic actors have enhanced capacity for development of child-sensitive policies and plans, as well as the considerationof social accountability in public processes.

description.narrative: Les 40 communes de convergence ont institutionnalisé des mécanismes de participation des enfants, des jeunes et des communautés à la gouvernance locale depuis 2019.; Les conseils consultatifs des enfants et des jeunes (CCEJ) et les cadres de redevabilité sociale (CRS) contribuent au renforcement de la participation citoyenne et du contrôle de l’action publique. En 2021, 20 communes de convergence additionnelles (ce qui porte à 24 sur 40) disposent d’un mécanisme fonctionnel de participation des enfants, des jeunes et des communautés à la gouvernance locale. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
